## 40mm Multi-shot Launcher Tender Announcement
### Overview

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has a requirement for a 40mm multi-shot launcher consisting of a compact, shoulder-fired module with a revolver-style cylinder design, capable of loading a minimum of 6 rounds. The contract period is for one year with an option to extend for up to three additional one-year periods.

### Scope of Work

The successful bidder will be responsible for delivering a complete and functional 40mm multi-shot launcher, meeting all the mandatory technical evaluation criteria as outlined in the bid solicitation. The delivery deadline is three months after contract award.

### Tender Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation will be based solely on mandatory technical criteria. Bidders must meet all the requirements specified in the bid solicitation to be considered responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award.

### Tender Submission

Tenders must be submitted electronically to [anouk.st-aubin@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:anouk.st-aubin@rcmp-grc.gc.ca) no later than April 23rd, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST. The tender documents, including amendments, are available for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).

### Important Notice

Canada has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. This regime applies to all contracting activities of the RCMP, including this tender. By submitting a bid, bidders acknowledge that they have reviewed and understand the Integrity Regime requirements.

### Indigenous Procurement

The RCMP encourages Indigenous businesses to participate in this tender opportunity. Bidders can register in the Federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) to increase their visibility and access additional business opportunities.

### Reference Documents

The following documents are attached to this tender notice:

* This tender notice
* Solicitation amendment 1
* Solicitation amendment 2
* Solicitation amendment 3
* Solicitation amendment 4
* Request for Proposal (RFP) document

Please note that Canada is not responsible for the content of external websites and will not assume any liabilities for third-party information. It is the sole responsibility of the bidder to regularly consult the Government Electronic Tendering Service for the most up-to-date information.
